A student holds one end of a string. The other end of the string is attached to a metal ring, as shown, that can slide freely on a vertical rod. The student creates a transverse wave that travels along the string. The student changes the amplitude of the wave and measures the amplitude of the motion of the ring. The data are shown in the table. Based on this data, what can be concluded about the polarization of the wave on the string?

choices.label: The wave was polarized at some angle between vertical and horizontal that was the same for all trials.
The polarization of the wave had various orientations.

content.answer: The polarization of the wave had various orientations.
